items.title: Wood Chip
items.description: How much wood could wood chip chuck? Nanocellulose, a wood-derived material, has been shown as a viable option to replace silicon as a substrate for computer chips.

items.title: Silk Chip
items.description: Silk, which shares many of the same properties as spider silk, can act as glass fiber optic cables that carry information for electronic devices. Silk is both a water-soluble and biodegradable: when combined with other inorganic semiconductors, the substrate can be used to build devices.

items.title: Algae Battery
items.description: Batteries, but make it green. Algae has the potential to be used as bio-batteries. It works similarly to solar cells by capturing sunlight, stores it, and converting it to electric current.
